title: Highest Real Interest Rate
description: In 2023, Madagascar had the highest real interest rate in the world at 41.30%.

title: Highest Risk Premium on Lending
description: Madagascar's risk premium on lending was the highest globally in 2023, reaching 43.86%.

title: Lowest Utility Services Score
description: In 2024, Madagascar had the lowest overall score for utility services at 35.04.

title: Lowest Operational Efficiency in Utility Services
description: Madagascar scored the lowest in operational efficiency of utility service provision with a score of 22.38 in 2024.

title: Highest Value Lost Due to Electrical Outages
description: In 2022, Madagascar had the highest value lost due to electrical outages, amounting to 24% of sales for affected firms.

title: Shortest Compulsory Education Duration
description: Madagascar had the shortest compulsory education duration in 2023, lasting only 5 years.

title: Lowest Persistence to Grade 5 for Females
description: In 2018, only 33.26% of female students in Madagascar persisted to grade 5, the lowest rate globally.

title: Highest Rate of Primary School Repeaters
description: Madagascar had the highest rate of primary school repeaters in 2018, with 26.07% of students repeating a grade.

title: Fewest Trained Male Primary Teachers
description: In 2019, only 11.16% of male primary teachers in Madagascar were trained, the lowest percentage worldwide.

title: Fewest Trained Upper Secondary Teachers
description: Madagascar had the lowest percentage of trained upper secondary teachers in 2019, with only 15.89% being trained.

title: Lowest Government Expenditure on Tertiary Education
description: In 2017, Madagascar spent only 0.58% of its government education budget on tertiary education, the lowest globally.

title: Lowest Urban Basic Sanitation Coverage
description: In 2022, only 21.64% of Madagascar's urban population had access to basic sanitation services, the lowest rate worldwide.

title: High Female Labor Force Participation
description: In 2024, Madagascar had a high female labor force participation rate of 82.56%, one of the highest in the world.
